title: Royal Society Music & Acoustics: Scientific Revolution in Sound
description: Complete collection of musical and acoustical contributions to the Royal Society (1665-1700), documenting the founding era of scientific study of sound, music theory, and vibration. Includes the coining of 'microphone' and groundbreaking experiments in acoustics.
curatedBy: Embassy of the Free Mind Collection

keyContributors.name: Francis North (1637-1685)
keyContributors.contribution: Philosophical Essay of Musick (1677) - Mechanistic theory of harmony, Coincidence Theory of consonance

keyContributors.name: Robert Hooke (1635-1703)
keyContributors.contribution: Experiments with vibrating plates (1680), musical tones from brass cogs (1681)

keyContributors.name: John Wallis (1616-1703)
keyContributors.contribution: Edited Ptolemy's Harmonics (1682), mathematical music theory, comparative ancient/modern tuning

keyContributors.name: William Noble & Thomas Pigot
keyContributors.contribution: Vibrating strings experiments (1674) - stationary nodes, sympathetic resonance, harmonic series

researchValue: Complete documentation of Royal Society's pioneering acoustics research during the Scientific Revolution. Shows the transition from ancient Pythagorean music theory (Ptolemy) to modern experimental and mathematical approaches. Essential for history of science, music theory, and acoustics.
